com.versant.util
Class BEProfile

java.lang.Object
  com.versant.util.BEProfile

public class BEProfile
extends java.lang.Object

BEProfile provides setters and getters to read and modify the back end profile of a particular database.

An instance of this class can be obtained by using the DBUtility.getBEProfile(java.lang.String) factory method. Every time an instance of this class is obtained the back end profile is read.

An instance of this class is required to modify the existing back end profile. The back end profile can be modified using DBUtility.writeBEProfile(com.versant.util.BEProfile) method.

For detailed information about each of these profile parameters refer to the VERSANT System Manual.

                                     java.lang.String location)
Set the size and the location of the system volume that contains the database system catalogs and objects.

Parameters:
size - the size of the system volume. The default size is 128M. The minimum size is 1800K.
location - either the absolute or relative path (including name) of the system volume.

setAsyncBufferCleaner

public void setAsyncBufferCleaner(int number)
Set the async_buffer_cleaner profile parameter.

If number is set to zero, the database server process itself will flush the database server cache. If this parameter is greater than zero, a separate thread will be used.

Parameters:
number - the setting for this profile parameter.

getAsyncBufferCleaner

public int getAsyncBufferCleaner()
Get the current setting for the async_buffer_cleaner parameter.

Returns:
an in representing the setting.

If number is set to zero, the database server process itself will flush the database logging cache. If this parameter is greater than zero, a separate thread will be used.

Parameters:
number - the setting for this profile parameter.

setBFDirtyHighWaterMark

public void setBFDirtyHighWaterMark(int number)
Specify when an asynchronous page cleaner thread will start to flush the dirty pages in the buffer pool to disk. The default value is 70% of the number of the pages in the buffer pool as specified in the max_page_bufs parameter.

Parameters:
number - the number of dirty pages in the buffer pool above which flushing should be done.

getBFDirtyHighWaterMark

public int getBFDirtyHighWaterMark()
Get the current setting for the bf_dirty_high_water_mark in the back end profile.

Returns:
an integer representing the setting for bf_dirty_high_water_mark.

setBFDirtyLowWaterMark

public void setBFDirtyLowWaterMark(int number)
Specify when an asynchronous page cleaner thread will stop clearing the buffer pool of pages containing the . The default value is 50% of the number of the pages in the buffer pool as specified in the max_page_bufs parameter.

Parameters:
number - the number of dirty pages in the buffer pool below which flushing should be stopped.

getBFDirtyLowWaterMark

public int getBFDirtyLowWaterMark()
Get the current setting for the bf_dirty_low_water_mark in the back end profile.

Returns:
an integer representing the setting for bf_dirty_low_water_mark.

setNumberOfClasses

public void setNumberOfClasses(int number)
Specify the maximum number of cached user defined classes.

The default number for cached user defined classes is 480. If more than the specified number or default number of classes are accessed during the time a database is running an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
number - the maximum number of cached user defined classes.

Caution: If the heap size is too large, it might not be possible to allocate shared memory when the database is started.

Parameters:
size - size of the heap. Indicate Kilobytes with a K

setLockWaitTimeout

public void setLockWaitTimeout(int number_of_seconds)
Set the number of seconds the server should wait for obtaining a lock on an object before generating an lock wait time out error. The default wait time is 60 seconds. Use -1 to specify wait forever and 0 to specify immediate return.

Parameters:
number_of_seconds - the wait time in seconds.

getLockWaitTimeout

public int getLockWaitTimeout()

Returns:
an integer representing the lock wait time out in seconds.

setMaxPageBuffs

public void setMaxPageBuffs(int number_pages)
Specify the maximum number of 16K buffers caching disk pages from data volumes. The default value is 256 and should work well for most applications. For a large database it might be possible to get performance benefits by increasing this parameter. For small databases this parameter can be reduced to save memory.

Caution: This parameter strongly influences system performances.

getMaxPageBuffs

public int getMaxPageBuffs()
Get the current setting for the max_page_buffs parameter.

Returns:
an integer representing the current setting for the maximum number of 16K buffers.

setTraceComps

public void setTraceComps(java.lang.String options)
List the database components to be traced. The list is a comma delimited String of the server components. There should be no spaces between the components. The components that can be traced include: 

 am Trace the current state of queries or cursors. 
 at Trace entries created, updated, and deleted in the internal AT table. 
 bf Trace the buffer manager. 
 lg Trace logging and recovery. 
 ps Trace process/thread operations. 
 rc Trace object creation, modification, and deletion. 
 tr Trace transaction operations.

If the components related to transaction operations, buffer manager and process thread operations are to be traced the options string would be

"tr,bf,ps".

Parameters:
options - the list of components to be traced.

getTraceComps

public java.lang.String getTraceComps()
Get the list of database server components that are currently being traced.

Returns:
a String that represents a comma delimited list of components.

Parameters:
status - true if commit_flush is to be on, false otherwise

Returns:
true if commit_flush is on, false otherwise.

setPollingOptimize

public void setPollingOptimize(boolean status)
set Fault Tolerant recovery strategy. The Default is false (off), which prevents applications from getting polling induced deadlock errors.

If polling_optimize is off, the polling process, while re-synchronizing the replica pair after a failure, applies changes one object at a time. Each object is first locked, then the update is applied, and then the lock is released. This prevents polling induced deadlock.

If polling_optimize is on, objects are group read, then changed, then released. This greatly improves performance. However, this might cause a polling induced deadlock error. If polling_optimize is on, applications should be able to handle deadlock

Parameters:
status - true if polling_optimize is to be on, false otherwise

getPollingOptimize

public boolean getPollingOptimize()
Get the current setting for polling_optimize.

Returns:
true if polling_optimize is on, false otherwise.

setAssertionLevel

public void setAssertionLevel(int level)
Set the assertion_level.

Parameters:
level - can be set from 0 to 2. If assertion level is 0 the system performs only simple assertions. The higher the level, more expensive is the checking.

getAssertionLevel

public int getAssertionLevel()
Get the current setting for the assertion_level parameter in the profile.

Returns:
an integer representing the assertion_level.

setEventMsgTransientQueueSize

public void setEventMsgTransientQueueSize(int size)
Set the maximum number of per-transaction event messages that can be held in the transient event queue. The default transient event message queue size is 2048 bytes. You can set it to any value between 0 and 2^32, non-inclusive.

The persistent event message queue size is 232, and it cannot be changed.

VERSANT does not use the Operating System message queue.

Parameters:
size - the message queue size.

getEventMsgTransientQueueSize

public int getEventMsgTransientQueueSize()
Get the current setting for the event_msg_transient_queue_size parameter in the profile.

Returns:
an integer that represents the queue size.

setEventDaemon

public void setEventDaemon(java.lang.String daemonPath,
                           java.lang.String daemonArguments)
Specify the full path to the Event Daemon and any optional parameters to the code that will start the event daemon.

You must separately write this code, which is operating system specific. T this code must be on the same machine as the database. When a database invokes the executable, it inserts the database name as the first parameter and then follows it with your parameters. If you wish to use multiple parameters, you must enclose them in double quotes and then parse the parameters yourself.

If you are using VERSANT EVD, then specify the full path to the veddriver executable. For the daemonArguments the full path to the config file can be specified. if the environment variable VED_CONFIGFILE is already set to the location of the config file then daemonArguments can be null.

Parameters:
daemonPath - the location of the event daemon
daemonArguments - optional arguments to be passed to the daemon.

getEventDaemon

public java.lang.String getEventDaemon()
Get the current setting for the Event Daemon parameter in the back end profile.

Returns:
a String representing the setting for the event_daemon parameter in the profile.

setCustom_BE_Plugins

public void setCustom_BE_Plugins(java.lang.String plugin)
Define the custom plugins. The Specification of the plugin could include more than just the location of the dll or the shared library. For Example: If the plugin being specified is a Virtual Attribute plugin (nocase.dll or national.dll) then the path to the location of the shared library/DLL and the path to the location of the directory containing the internationalization libraries have to be specified.

In the example below the VERSANT runtime path is appended to the location of the plugins.

Example: 

 
     BEProfile be = DBUtility.getBEProfile(database);
     String versantRuntime = DBUtility.versantRuntimePath();
     String versantRoot = DBUtility.versantRootPath();
     String OS = System.getProperty("os.name").toLowerCase();
     if (OS.indexOf("window") == 0) {
        String pluginPath = versantRuntime + "\\" + "bin" + "\\" ;
        String nationalPlugin = pluginPath + "national.dll" + "$" + versantRuntime;
        String nocasePlugin = pluginPath + "nocase.dll"   + "$" + versantRuntime;
        be.setCustom_BE_Plugins(nationalPlugin);
        be.addToCustom_BE_Plugins(nocasePlugin );    
      }

Parameters:
plugin - the plugin to be added.

addToCustom_BE_Plugins

public void addToCustom_BE_Plugins(java.lang.String plugin)
Define the custom plugins. The Specification of the plugin could include more than just the location of the dll or the shared library. For Example: If the plugin being specified is a Virtual Attribute plugin (nocase.dll or national.dll) then the path to the location of the shared library/DLL and the path to the location of the lib directory containing the internationalization libraries have to be specified. In the example below VERSANT_RUN_ROOT is appended to the location of the plugins.

Example: 

 
     BEProfile be = DBUtility.getBEProfile(database);
     String versantRuntime = DBUtility.versantRuntimePath();
     String versantRoot = DBUtility.versantRootPath();
     String OS = System.getProperty("os.name").toLowerCase();
     if (OS.indexOf("window") == 0) {
        String pluginPath = versantRuntime + "\\" + "bin" + "\\" ;
        String nationalPlugin = pluginPath + "national.dll" + "$" + versantRuntime;
        String nocasePlugin = pluginPath + "nocase.dll"   + "$" + versantRuntime;
        be.setCustom_BE_Plugins(nationalPlugin);
        be.addToCustom_BE_Plugins(nocasePlugin );    
      }

Parameters:
plugin - the plugin to be added.

a string representing the current setting for the custom_be_plugins parameter in the profile.

getObePortBeginNumber

public int getObePortBeginNumber()
Get starting port number to be used for connections by obe

Returns:
obe port begin number

setObePortBeginNumber

public void setObePortBeginNumber(int startPortNumber)
Set starting port number to be used for connections

Parameters:
startPortNumber - starting port number If no parameters are given (the default), the obe is left to decide which port to use. The suggestion for these parameters are ports above 5000 which are dedicated for user applications. obe_port_end must be greater that the obe_port_begin, otherwise obe_port_end is reset to equal obe_port_begin.

getObePortEndNumber

public int getObePortEndNumber()
Get ending port number to be used for connections by obe

Returns:
obe port end number

setObePortEndNumber

public void setObePortEndNumber(int endPortNumber)
Set ending port number to be used for connections by obe

Parameters:
endPortNumber - ending port number The suggestion for these parameters obe_port_end must be greater that the obe_port_begin, otherwise obe_port_end is reset to equal obe_port_begin.

getSpinCount

public int getSpinCount()
Get the current value for spin_count parameter. This parameter specifies the maximum count executed in the busy wait portion of the spin lock. The spin lock protects the latch data structure.

Returns:
the value for the profile parameter

setSpinCount

public void setSpinCount(int number)
This parameter specifies the maximum count executed in the busy wait portion of the spin lock. The spin lock protects the latch data structure. Default 2000

Parameters:
number - the maximum count executed

getLockBatchSize

public int getLockBatchSize()
Get the current value for lock_batch_size parameter. This parameter specifies the number of the lock request to be batched together and processed under one acquisition of the lock latch during acquirelocks / release locks.

Returns:
the value for the profile parameter

setLockBatchSize

public void setLockBatchSize(int number)
Set the current value for lock_batch_size parameter. This parameter specifies the number of the lock request to be batched together and processed under one acquisition of the lock latch during acquirelocks / release locks. Default 1000

Parameters:
number - number of the lock request to be batched together
